content:
With the reorganization of several colleges students at the University of Tennessee can look forward to seeing more sections of usually closed courses and a new office for assisting undergraduates as part of an ongoing reorganization this summer PERIOD

Anne Mayhew vice provost for academic affairs said the reorganization is being done to improve academic programs and save the university money PERIOD

 Mayhew said PERIOD

The Colleges of Education and Human Ecology have been combined to form the College of Education Health and Human Sciences with John Koontz named as the interim dean PERIOD

 Mayhew said PERIOD

Also the College of Communications and the School of Information Science have been merged together to form the College of Communications and Information Sciences PERIOD Appointed as interim dean of the new college was Faye Julian PERIOD

Mayhew said all majors minors and course offerings in this college as well will continue to be offered PERIOD

 she said PERIOD

UT has also created a new office of Undergraduate Academic Services that will begin operating by Aug PERIOD  PERIOD The director of the new office which will be located at  Volunteer Blvd. will be Beverly D PERIOD Anderson PERIOD

 Mayhew said PERIOD 

Furthermore UT added additional sections of Accounting  Economics  Spanish  and Political Science  for the fall hoping to ease student difficulties in filling their schedules PERIOD
